title: Top startup and tech stories this week - The Economic Times
summary:
Top Startup and Tech Stories This Week

Date: This week

Source: ETtech

Welcome to a new edition of ETtech Unwrapped – our weekend newsletter packed with the most important stories this week. Here are the top highlights:

  • Exclusive Q&A with Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella: He emphasizes the need for the US to innovate and compete, stating, "Anyone who doesn't tap into India's human capital is choosing not to be competitive."
  • Kabeer Biswas joins Flipkart: The cofounder of Dunzo will lead Flipkart’s quick commerce business, Minutes.
  • Improved Financials for Startups: Several startups have ended FY24 with improved bottom lines despite funding challenges.
  • NRAI to approach CCI: The National Restaurant Association of India may challenge Zomato and Swiggy over their new 10-minute food delivery offerings.
  • Sachin Bansal’s potential sale of Ola stake: Flipkart’s cofounder is reportedly in talks to sell his $100 million investment in Ola at a premium.
  • Innovaccer raises $275 million: The SaaS firm closes a new funding round for AI and cloud development.
  • Swiggy launches multiple delivery apps: New apps introduced include Pyng for professional services and Snacc for quick food delivery.
  • Data protection regulations: The new DPDP rules may open opportunities for regulatory-tech firms in compliance and privacy sectors.
Saty Nadella asserted that tech and non-tech distinctions will disappear as we embrace AI.

Overall, the tech landscape is evolving with significant investments, strategic leadership changes, and regulatory developments that may shape the future of startups in India.
newTitle: Top Startup and Tech Stories This Week

Ranked: AI Models With the Lowest Hallucination Rates - Visual Capitalist
summary:
AI Models With the Lowest Hallucination Rates

Publication Date: December 11, 2024 Source: Visual Capitalist

As AI tools become more prevalent, it’s crucial to consider that these models may generate incorrect information, known as hallucinations. This chart visualizes the top 15 large language models (LLMs) with the lowest hallucination rates, providing insights into their performance.

  • The hallucination rate indicates how frequently a model produces inaccurate information.
  • Data sourced from Vectara and updated as of December 11, 2024.
  • Models listed include Zhipu AI GLM-4-9B-Chat and Google Gemini-2.0-Flash-Exp, both with a rate of 1.3%.
  • Smaller models show competitive performance, achieving lower hallucination rates than some larger models.
“Measuring hallucination rates is becoming increasingly critical as AI systems are deployed in high-stakes applications.”

The ranking highlights the importance of accuracy in AI applications, especially as they are utilized in sensitive fields such as healthcare and finance.
newTitle: Ranked AI Models With the Lowest Hallucination Rates

title: 17 weird, wonderful and terrifying robots we've seen at CES 2025 so far — from a humanlike 'companion' to a robotic mixologist - Livescience.com
summary:
17 Unique and Innovative Robots at CES 2025

Date: January 15, 2025 Source: Live Science

CES 2025 showcases a wide array of robots from therapeutic machines to robotic pets. This year's highlights show significant advancements in AI and robotics.

  • A Pixar-like robot lamp called Mi-Mo, customizable and adaptable.
  • The R2D3 droid, designed to assist with household tasks using advanced AI.
  • The Wybot S2 Pro, a pool-cleaning robot that autonomously returns to charge.
  • The HAGAMOSphere, a drone that can both roll and fly, ideally for disaster recovery.
  • Aria, a humanlike android designed to learn and interact.
  • The SwitchBot K20+ Pro, featuring robotic arms for cleaning and other tasks.
  • BeatBot's robotic turtle aimed at ocean cleanup and research.
  • Samsung's Ballie, a home assistant droid inspired by Star Wars.
  • Unitree's backflipping robot dog.
  • A mini robotic dog designed to teach coding.
  • Mirokaï, an android with an animated digital face.
  • LOOI, a robot created using a smartphone app.
  • Mirumi, a furry robot companion that attaches to bags.
  • A robotic coffee machine that creates intricate coffee art.
  • ADAM, a robotic bartender with AI capabilities.
  • An autonomous wheel that can transform any object into a robot.
  • A chess-playing robot with a high ELO skill level.
"The future is about integrating AI with human-like interaction in household robots." - Live Science

This year's CES highlights how robotics are becoming an integral part of everyday life, showcasing advancements that blend technology with creativity.
newTitle: 17 Unique and Innovative Robots at CES 2025

title: POCO launches X7 series with Brand Ambassador Akshay Kumar - Greater Kashmir
summary:
POCO Launches X7 Series with Akshay Kumar as Brand Ambassador

Date: January 10, 2023 | Source: Greater Kashmir

Srinagar, Jan 10: POCO, one of India’s fastest-growing consumer tech brands, unveiled its flagship X7 Series—POCO X7 5G and POCO X7 Pro 5G—at an event in Jaipur. Bollywood actor Akshay Kumar was introduced as the brand ambassador, embodying POCO’s philosophy of “Xceed Your Limits.”

  • The POCO X7 series introduces the segment’s first 1.5K AMOLED 3D Curved Display.
  • It features flagship-grade Corning Gorilla Glass protection and an IP66+ rating for water and dust resistance.
  • The POCO X7 Pro has India's largest 6550mAh battery with Silicon Carbon Technology for improved efficiency.
  • The series debuts the MediaTek Dimensity 8400 Ultra processor and features Xiaomi HyperOS 2.0.
Himanshu Tandon, Country Head of POCO India, said, “At POCO, innovation drives every decision we make. With the X7 Series, we are setting new benchmarks in the premium smartphone category.”

This launch exemplifies POCO's commitment to bringing flagship innovation at an incredible value to its users while enhancing its brand appeal through a prominent ambassador.
newTitle: POCO Launches X7 Series with Akshay Kumar as Brand Ambassador

title: OnePlus 12 vs. OnePlus 13: Is it upgraded enough? [Video] - 9to5Google
summary:
OnePlus 12 vs. OnePlus 13: Is the Upgrade Worth It?

Publication Date: January 7, 2025
Source: 9to5Google

The OnePlus 12 surprised many in 2024, setting high expectations for its successor, the OnePlus 13. This article analyzes whether the latest model brings enough new features to justify upgrading.

  • OnePlus 13 retains a similar design to OnePlus 12 with improvements in shape and a flat display.
  • The 13 features a better ultrasonic in-display fingerprint scanner.
  • Enhancements in battery technology with a 6,000 mAh capacity, compared to 5,400 mAh in the 12.
  • Camera system improvements but some downgrades in optical zoom capabilities.
  • OxygenOS 15 offers a fresh experience across both models.
“Nobody who owns the OnePlus 12 should ditch their device in favor of the OnePlus 13.”

In conclusion, while the OnePlus 13 introduces several enhancements, existing OnePlus 12 users may find the upgrades insufficient to warrant a switch.
newTitle: OnePlus 12 vs. OnePlus 13: Is the Upgrade Worth It?
